div1.p: IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES IN AND FOR THE WESTER DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the matter of the application of N. T. B. Pentreath, for A writ of Habeas Corpus.
PETITION FOR WRIT.
TO THE HONORABLE C. H. HANFORD JUDGE OF THE SAID COURT.

The petition of N. T. B. Pentreath respectfully shows: That he, the said N. T. B. Pentreath is a citizen of the United States, that contrary to the Constitution of the United States and the extradition treaty existing between the United States of America and Great Brittain, he is unlawfully imprisoned, detained, confined and restrained of his liberty, by Thomas Delaney Chief of Police of the City of Seattle, State of Washignton; in the City Jail of said City.

That said imprisonment, detention, confinement and restraint is illegal and that the illegality thereof consists in this to-wit; that the arresta nd said detention, confinement, and restraint was made, exercised and continued without any legal warrant of arrest or excuse therefor,

That is the best knowledge and information of your petition - or, the only excuse and authority of said arrest and detention, was a request by telegraph from some official or officials in British Columbia, Canada for the arrest of your petitioner. The arrest was made on the 25th day of March 1905, and your petitioner is still held in custody without warrant or legal excuse,
WHEREFORE: your petitioner prays:

That a writ of habeas corpus may be granted, directed to the said Thomas Delaney, Chief of Police is aforesaid, commanding him to have the body of the said N. T. B. Pentreath before your Honor at a time and place therein to be specified to do and receive what ever shall then and there, be considered by your Honor concerning the said N. T. B. Pentreath, together with th time and cause of his detention, and asid writ; and that he, the said N. T. B. Pentreath may be restored to his liberty.
Norborne T. B. Pentreath
State of Washington, County of King.

N. T. B. Pentreath being duly sworn on oath says, I am the petitioner in the above petition for a writ of habeas corpus, I have heard the foregoing petition, know the contents thereof and believe the same to be true.
Norborne T. B. Pentreath
Subscribed and sword to before me this 29th day of March 1905.
Z. B. Rowan
Notary Public in and for the State of Washington, residing at Seattle.
In the United States Circuit Court FOR THE Western DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, Northern Division
In the Matter of The Petition of N. T. B. Pentreath for Writ of Habeas Corpus
FILED IN THE U. S. CIRCUIT COURT, Western Dist, of Washington, Mar 30 1905
A. REEVES AYRES, Clerk
A. N. Moore, Dep.
Petition
J. L. Waller + Z. B. Rowan
Attorney for Petitioner
